In colorimetry and color theory, 'colorfulness', 'chroma', and 'saturation' are
related but distinct concepts referring to the perceived intensity of a specific
color. Colorfulness is the degree of difference between a color and gray. Chroma
is the colorfulness relative to the brightness of another color that appears
white under similar viewing conditions. Saturation is the colorfulness of a
color relative to its own brightness. Mark D. Fairchild.
